clinical_study.brief_title: Stem Cell Transplantation In-patient With Neurological Sequelae Due to Encephalitis or Meningitis
clinical_study.official_title: The Outcomes of Autologous Bone Marrow-derived Mononuclear Cell Transplantation In-patient With Neurological Sequelae Due to Encephalitis or Meningitis at Vinmec International Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

clinical_study.source: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of autologous bone marrow-derived mononuclear cell transplantation in-patient with neurological sequelae due to encephalitis or meningitis

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow-derived mononuclear cell in 22 patients with neurological sequelae due to encephalitis or meningitis at Vinmec International Hospital, Hanoi, Vietnam

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 months, and 12 months after transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Change in Total Score of Gross Motor Function Measure GMFM-88

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 months, and 12 months after transplantation
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle tone are assessed by Modified Ashworth Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Examples of adverse events to look for: fever, infections, vomit, epilepsy

arm_group.description: Stem cell transplantation 2 intrathecal administrations of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells at baseline and 6 months afterward

intervention.description: Transplantation of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Cells

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Neurological sequelae due to encephalitis or meningitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Coagulation disorders
- Allergy to anesthetic agents
- Severe health conditions such as cancer, failure of heart, lung, liver or kidney
- Active infections
